intro: Curinila rheedei, commonly known as the Malabar nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its dark purple or black berries, which are typically toxic to humans but may be used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in dense forests. Its flowers are usually small and white or greenish, with a distinctive star-shaped appearance.
